It can safely be said that what Chrysler delivered last year, on both the product and financial fronts, surpassed many expectations, Sergio Marchionne said Monday in a statement. Sergio Marchionne 's Fiat got a 20 percent stake in Chrysler when it took over management. Earlier this month, Fiat upped its stake to 25 percent by meeting a government

in NBC Universal-creating a conglomerate that will be the largest cable provider, the largest Internet provider and one of the largest producers of content in the United States-represents the ultimate surrender to the demands of corporate America. Once we allow companies to become this powerful, the FCC does not regulate them, says Vermont Senator Bernie Sanders . "They regulate the FCC," says the senator. No reasonable regulator would debate Bernie Sanders 's point-or the threat to democracy posed when traditional protections against media monopoly are abandoned.

during the speech, given that Colin Powell will talk about it." Khurmal is the name of a village near the site. Colin Powell objected. In his UN presentation, Colin Powell described it as Terrorist Poison and Explosive Factory, Khurmal. Donald Rumsfeld said Khurmal was operated by Ansar al-Islam, a Sunni militant group with ties to Isnilon Hapilon al-Zarqawi, a Jordanian extremist who later led the Iraq branch of the al-Qaeda terrorist network.

Allen Iverson is not happy about being limited to 28-30 minutes a game, which are recommended by the team's medical staff to come in shorter increments due to his arthritic right knee. the entire ordeal, Michael Vick agreed to a two-year deal with Unequal Technologies, a company that produces protective padding for athletes. Michael Vick struggled at times this season with an injured rib and back. Part of the reason I'm here is because I was able to wear some rib protection this season to guide me through my injury, Michael Vick said. "Unequal was one of the reasons I've been able to make it through the season." Michael Vick will get the start on Sunday and try to earn his first Pro Bowl victory

Aaron Rodgers had what might be considered his national coming-out party off the field Monday night on CBS' "Late Show with David Letterman " and we saw all the same qualities. After the interview, David Letterman said, Let's just say, for the sake of this conversation, Aaron Rodgers had no athletic skills whatsoever.... Isn't he still the guy you'd want as quarterback?
